skill.name: systematic-debugging
skill.description: Four-phase root cause investigation before attempting fixes. Use when debugging bugs, test failures, or unexpected behavior.
skill.summary: Four-phase root cause investigation before attempting fixes. Use when debugging bugs, test failures,...
skill.author: DMJGilbert

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown instructions for systematic debugging methodology. No executable code, scripts, or file operations. All 14 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misidentifying common English words ('Four', 'For') as cryptographic terms and legitimate debugging practices (checking git history) as system reconnaissance.

content.value_statement: Debugging without a systematic approach leads to wasted time and new bugs. This skill provides a four-phase methodology to find root causes before attempting fixes, dramatically improving first-time fix success rates.
actual_capabilities: Guide through four-phase root cause investigation
Provide pattern analysis framework for comparing working vs broken code
Apply scientific method with hypothesis testing
Detect when architectural problems require refactoring over symptom fixes
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests automatically
Does not access external debugging tools or profilers
Does not integrate with issue trackers or bug databases
Requires user to manually gather diagnostic evidence

use_cases.title: Fix bugs efficiently
use_cases.description: Apply root cause analysis before writing code changes to avoid introducing new bugs

use_cases.title: Analyze test failures
use_cases.description: Systematically investigate test failures to determine whether issues are in code or tests

use_cases.title: Debug production issues
use_cases.description: Use diagnostic evidence gathering and hypothesis testing to diagnose deployment failures

prompt_templates.title: Debug a bug
prompt_templates.prompt: Use systematic debugging methodology to investigate this issue. Apply the four phases: root cause investigation, pattern analysis, hypothesis testing, and implementation. Before proposing any fix, read error messages, reproduce consistently, check recent changes, and trace data flow.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze test failure
prompt_templates.prompt: A test is failing. Apply systematic debugging: read the full error message and stack trace, identify the exact assertion failure, compare with passing tests, form a hypothesis about the root cause, and verify with minimal code changes.

prompt_templates.title: Multiple fixes failed
prompt_templates.scenario: When previous fixes did not work
prompt_templates.prompt: Previous debugging attempts failed. Apply systematic debugging from Phase 1: stop attempting quick fixes, question whether this is an architectural problem, gather fresh diagnostic evidence, and ask whether refactoring is needed.

prompt_templates.title: New bug investigation
prompt_templates.prompt: A regression was introduced. Use systematic debugging: check git history for recent changes, backtrace data flow from the error, compare with similar working code, form a testable hypothesis, and implement a TDD fix.

output_examples.input: The login function throws 'undefined is not a function' when users try to reset passwords
output: Phase 1 - Investigation: Read stack trace to find exact line, reproduce by calling resetPassword(), check git log for auth module changes, trace where the undefined function is called
Phase 2 - Pattern Analysis: Find working authentication code, compare import statements and dependencies, list all differences
Phase 3 - Hypothesis: The resetPassword module is missing the validateEmail import, evidenced by undefined function at line 45
Phase 4 - Implementation: Write failing test, add missing import, verify all tests pass

output_examples.input: A test is failing with 'Expected 5 but got 3' in the shopping cart total calculation
output: Phase 1 - Investigation: Read the full test error, locate the exact assertion, find the test setup code, reproduce the failure locally
Phase 2 - Pattern Analysis: Compare with passing cart tests, identify differences in test setup and product data
Phase 3 - Hypothesis: The discount calculation is not being applied because the coupon flag is being read before initialization
Phase 4 - Implementation: Write failing test that verifies coupon flag initialization, reorder the initialization code, confirm all tests pass

best_practices: Always trace data flow backward from errors to find where bad values originate
Compare working code against broken code to identify the root cause pattern
Change only one variable at a time when testing hypotheses
anti_patterns: Proposing fixes without fully understanding the root cause
Attempting multiple simultaneous changes during debugging
Making quick patches without gathering diagnostic evidence first

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Use it whenever you need debugging assistance.

faq.question: How long does systematic debugging take?
faq.answer: Initial investigation takes 15-30 minutes but achieves 95% first-time fix success versus hours of trial-and-error.

faq.question: When should I stop trying fixes?
faq.answer: Stop after three failed fix attempts. This signals an architectural problem requiring deeper investigation.

faq.question: Does this skill run tests automatically?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides methodology guidance. You must manually reproduce issues and run tests.

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-only skill with no code execution or file access. It provides guidance only.

faq.question: How is this different from other debugging approaches?
faq.answer: It enforces root cause analysis before any fix attempt, preventing symptom patches and new bug introduction.
